 ** _Users Can Now Create Project Level Org Charts Within Organimi Platform_**

TORONTO , March 31, 2020 /CNW/ - Organimi, the market leading, cloud-based
subscription service for creating, updating and sharing organizational charts
online, announced today the launch of a much requested new feature - The
Matrix Organizational Chart.

Available globally, Organimi's project-based matrix charts provide a non-
hierarchical method for connecting and aligning employees and contractors in
both traditional and virtual organizations. Using the Matrix Chart feature,
users will now be able to display reporting structures at project levels in a
grid form rather than the traditional linear upwards-flowing hierarchy.  These
chart types are useful for employees with two or more reporting relationships,
as well as project teams including internal personnel and external
stakeholders as participants.

 _"As the industry pioneer and leading innovator in creating and delivering
purpose built organizational design solutions, we wanted to create a project-
based matrix chart with the same high-quality features, ease-of-use, and
functionality as our classic, feature rich and market proven organizational
chart solution,"_  co-founder, Eric Apps comments. _"This release will provide
our customers with a new and dynamic way to map out their organizational
structures and connect their teams to promote more effective communication and
collaboration. We're really excited for our customers to try this out, and are
grateful to our early adopters for providing the design and testing feedback
that helped us deliver this capability to users."_

In addition to the Matrix Chart, Organimi also offers an extensive set of
organizational chart design and employee collaboration tools for a wide
variety of private and public sector organizations. Organimi's software also
automatically builds and updates organizational charts in real-time, enabling
this updated information to be immediately deployed and shared across the
organization, while significantly reducing the time and cost associated with
creating, updating, and managing them.

Organimi integrates automatically with the industry leading Microsoft Azure
and Google G Suite platforms, provides API access, and connects with a wide
variety of other systems, applications, and tools. Organimi's organizational
chart tool helps organizations plan for the future, improve internal
communication, and mobilize sales. Hosted on Amazon AWS, Organimi is used by
over 150,000 small, mid, and large organizations worldwide. The adoption of
the software has grown tremendously as users share their charts and
collaborate with their colleagues. Many widely-known organizations have used
Organimi as their organizational design solution of choice for HR, planning
and account management applications, including users at organizations such as
Facebook, Uber, WeWork, Amazon, LinkedIn, and other global brands and Fortune
500 companies. To learn more about Oganimi and obtain a free trial, visit:
_[www.organimi.com](https://c212.net/c/link/?t=0&l=en&o=2765462-1&h=629157937&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.organimi.com%2F&a=www.organimi.com)_

 **About Organimi**

Organimi is the industry pioneer and market leader in purpose built online
solutions for organizational charts, photoboards and directories.  Organimi is
a cloud based org chart tool that makes it easy to create, share, and maintain
organizational charts. Their software helps organizations to connect, engage,
and collaborate through org charts that are simple and easy to use.  Free
forever for organizations of up to 50 members, and with a range of affordable,
feature rich plans for larger organizations, Organimi is used by thousands of
customers worldwide across private and public sectors to simplify and
streamline their organizational design and org chart maintenance processes.

What You Need to Know About Moving Your Startup to Canada

#### [Startup](https://www.inc.com/startup)

#

What You Need to Know About Moving Your Startup to Canada

## With favorable tax incentives and a "Startup Visa" program, Canada has much
to offer U.S. entrepreneurs.

[]()

[]()

[]()

[![](https://www.incimages.com/uploaded_files/image/100x100/Zoe_58376.jpg)](/author/zoe-
henry)[By Zoë Henry](/author/zoe-henry)Freelance
writer[@ZoeLaHenry](https://www.twitter.com/ZoeLaHenry)

![](https://www.incimages.com/uploaded_files/image/970x450/Galt-Riverfront-
web_83911.jpg)

Courtesy Company

When [Donald Trump](https://www.inc.com/alison-davis/what-donald-trump-doesnt-
want-you-to-know-about-leadership.html) and [Hillary
Clinton](https://www.inc.com/hillary-clinton/four-ways-to-jump-start-small-
business.html) emerged as the victors of last week's Super Tuesday polls, the
number of Google searches for "moving to Canada" spiked considerably.

Social-media activity--including [Twitter users announcing their great
migration](https://twitter.com/search?f=tweets&vertical=news&q=%22move%20to%20canada%22%20since%3A2016-03-01%20until%3A2016-03-02&src=typd&lang=en)\--was
centered on Trump's political ascendance. The prospect of his presidency has
spooked liberal American voters into considering a move up North,
[entrepreneurs included](https://www.inc.com/issie-lapowsky/canada-the-new-
start-up-frontier.html).

There are many things that make Canada an attractive place to live, like a
universal health care policy and an array of government-funded education
programs. But startup founders looking to relocate or start a business in the
area should note a number of caveats. Seed funding, for instance, isn't as
accessible as it might be in Silicon Valley, New York City, and Boston.

The process of becoming a permanent resident of Canada could take a few years.
In some cases, you could operate a startup on a work visa, and apply for
residency later down the line. (You would still need to register your company
as an "extra-provincial corporation," and regulations vary depending on the
region.)

Cédric Jeannot is a French national who immigrated to Canada from the U.S. to
launch his cyber-security company, APrivacy. Prior to moving up north in 2010,
he attended the University of Louisville in Kentucky for a PhD in applied
security.

"I liked that Canada has the drive and mentality of the U.S., but it has a lot
of the social sentiments of Europe," says Jeannot. He estimates that his
company ran almost entirely on government grants on the order of "hundreds of
thousands of dollars" for the first two years. While he was able to acquire a
Canadian work visa within two months before launching APrivacy, it took two
years for Jeannot to become certified as a permanent resident.

If you're serious about moving to Canada, here are some important things
you'll find:

## It's a comparatively small test market.

Companies that incorporate in Canada generally have a global scope, and
frequently set up offices in the U.S. While the Canadian market is small and
has fewer networking opportunities compared to Silicon Valley, it's still a
good place to try new products.

Facebook and Twitter have launched beta products in Canada before entering
into the "more important markets," noted Sunil Sharma, the managing director
at Extreme Venture Partners, who is gearing up to launch a startup boot camp
for international entrepreneurs in Canada.

## Favorable tax incentives.

The Canadian [SR&ED tax program](http://rd-
review.ca/eic/site/033.nsf/vwapj/4_Assessing_the_SRED_Tax_Credit-
eng.pdf/$FILE/4_Assessing_the_SRED_Tax_Credit-eng.pdf) lets founders get back
much as 35 percent of what they spend on R&D costs, for a maximum threshold of
$3 million.

"That kind of program does not exist anywhere in the U.S., and that's a huge
amount of money," said Brett Shellhammer, a former Silicon Valley tech worker
and serial entrepreneur. Currently based in
[Waterloo](https://www.inc.com/zoe-henry/waterloo-startup-hot-spot.html), he
relocated to Canada while working for OpenText in 2005--just after George W.
Bush was reelected as U.S. president.

"I had a lot of friends who said, 'If Bush wins again, I'm moving to Canada,'"
he recalls. "I'm the only one who did it."

Federal taxes will also subsidize many of the costs that U.S. citizens are
used to paying out of pocket, such as health care and education.

"I couldn't have done what I did here in Silicon Valley because of two things:
Labor costs and health care costs," Shellhammer added. His most successful
company so far, called Organimi, tabulates organizational charts for third-
party businesses, and sees revenues under $100,000 annually.

## Access to highly skilled tech talent, though it tends to migrate stateside.

The University of Waterloo has a widely recognized co-op program. It gives
students two years of full-time work experience at any of 120 companies, some
of which are located in Silicon Valley. As of 2012, an estimated one-third of
Waterloo's graduating software engineers were offered jobs by U.S. companies.

"The University of Waterloo is among the top few universities Google recruits
from around the world," said the school's Dean of Engineering, Pearl Sullivan,
in an interview with _Bloomberg._

The stream of talent is a boon for tech entrepreneurs, but alas, many of those
would-be hires are taking the jobs stateside.

Shellhammer puts it in not so glib terms:"It's fucking cold here. The guys who
graduate from Waterloo don't necessarily want to stay."

## Starting can be tricky, but it's not impossible.

Launching your Canadian branch may present obstacles, but a new initiative
aimed specifically at international entrepreneurs may help to streamline the
process.

Launched in 2013, the [Startup Visa program
](http://www.cic.gc.ca/english/immigrate/business/start-up/)sets aside 2,750
visas annually to bring foreign startups to Canada. Along with the CEO, the
government will immigrate up to five co-founders from a single company on
permanent residence, along with their families. The caveat: Your company must
be handpicked by a Canadian VC, incubator, or angel investor.

Sharma's Extreme Ventures Partners is one of 30 such funds that are licensed
to bring startups to Canada (though he estimates that since 2013, fewer than
100 of these visas have been allocated). He looks for companies with strong
teams, a good product, perhaps a Kickstarter campaign, and some technical
expertise and patents. Strong sales and public traction are bonuses.  

"What's halting the program is a lack of involvement from the investors, but
there's definitely not a lack of interest from the entrepreneurs," notes
Sheetal Nanda, the founder and principal lawyer with Toronto-based SN Legal.

Nanda says that since last Tuesday, she's seen an uptick in call volume, from
individuals and business owners interested in immigrating to Canada. "I was
kind of taken aback," she said. "But Canada is a wonderful place to live, so I
understand all the interest."

Published on: Mar 7, 2016

# Oregon football releases "organizational chart" ahead of matchup against
Auburn

NBCS NW Staff

[NBC Sports Northwest](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/)August 26, 2019,
5:46 PM UTC

> The week is finally here.

Head coach Mario Cristobal and the Ducks have released their "organizational
chart", which is just another name for a depth chart, ahead of their week [one
matchup against the [Auburn
Tigers](/ncaaf/teams/auburn/)](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/oregon-
ducks/justin-herbert-and-bo-nix-could-be-disney-movie-pt-1-history) at AT&T
Stadium in Arlington, Texas this Saturday.

> The first Organizational Chart of the 2019 season from the desk of Coach
> Cristobal.
> [#GoDucks](https://twitter.com/hashtag/GoDucks?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
> [pic.twitter.com/UmiNwQiJZh](https://t.co/UmiNwQiJZh)
>
> — Oregon Football (@oregonfootball) [August 26,
> 2019](https://twitter.com/oregonfootball/status/1166039591121371143?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

 __

 **Quick analysis from our[Oregon Ducks](/ncaaf/teams/oregon/) Insider Bri
Amaranthus:**

\- The Ducks expect tight ends [Jacob Breeland](/ncaaf/players/255241/) and
[Cam McCormick](/ncaaf/players/263248/) to play. This is big news since the
two [have battled through injuries this fall
camp](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/oregon-ducks/injury-updates-mario-
cristobal-jacob-breeland-given-green-light-vs-auburn).

\- [Travis Dye](/ncaaf/players/287566/) will be a special teams monster. [The
sophomore is sneaky fast and will be used all over the
field](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/oregon-ducks/oregon-running-back-
travis-dyes-spin-move-isnt-his-only-weapon). Having Dye and Jaylon Redd
returning kickoffs is a deadly, speedy combo.

- Isaac Slade-Matautia won starting ILB position, officially. The sophomore is ready to take on a [much bigger role this season](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/oregon-ducks/oregon-duck-x-factor-isaac-slade-matautia-emulating-marcus-mariota) after playing just seven games last year.

\- Will freshman [Kayvon Thibodeaux](/ncaaf/players/299118/) start? The 2019
ESPN No. 1 recruit is talented, no doubt about that, but according to the
chart, Gus Cumberlander will start at DE.

\- Senior Bryson Young is the STUD, [an important position in DC Andy Avalos'
defensive system](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/video/oregon-dc-andy-
avalos-focused-developing-studs-defense).

\- A LOT of true freshman in the defensive two-deep.





 _[Oregon football releases "organizational chart" ahead of matchup against
Auburn](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/oregon-ducks/oregon-football-
releases-organizational-chart-ahead-matchup-against-
auburn?cid=Yahoo&partner=ya4nbcs) originally appeared on [NBC Sports
Northwest](https://www.nbcsports.com/northwest/?cid=Yahoo&partner=ya4nbcs)_

# Gabe Kapler out as Phillies manager after two seasons

[Omnisport](http://omnisport.performgroup.com)October 10, 2019, 3:52 PM UTC

![A huge offseason spending spree netted only a one-game improvement for the
Phillies in 2019, prompting the end of Gabe Kapler's
reign.](https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/gunFd7Wn.bomiqe_ldXLjg--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTY0MDtoPTM2MA--/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/hMGQdijrQiVf1nfCcUY_Aw--~B/aD0xMDgwO3c9MTkyMDtzbT0xO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/http://media.zenfs.com/en-
GB/homerun/omnisport.uk/6c82a0d031eb0fa88c82c39b57504ac0)

A huge offseason spending spree netted only a one-game improvement for the
Phillies in 2019, prompting the end of Gabe Kapler's reign.

The Philadelphia Phillies have fired manager Gabe Kapler after a second
successive mediocre season.

The Phillies had high expectations for 2019 after loading up in the offseason,
but their roster moves only led to a one-game improvement from the previous
campaign.

Consequently, the team, who concluded an 81-81 season 11 days ago, announced
on Thursday that Kapler would not return for the final year of his contract.

 __

"Several years ago, I promised our loyal fans that I would do everything in my
power to bring a world championships team to our city," owner John Middleton
said in a  statement.

"During the second half of this season and continuing into this week, I have
evaluated our organisation extensively, a process that included talking to
many people both internally and around the league.

"Reassuring to me was the endorsement that people outside the Phillies gave to
the progress we have made recently, both organisationally and on the field.

"Nevertheless, with the knowledge that I have gained from my evaluation,
combined with my personal reflection on the 2019 season, I have decided that
some changes are necessary to achieve our ultimate objective.

"Consequently, we will replace our manager. I am indebted to Gabe for the
steadfast effort, energy and enthusiasm that he brought to our club, and we
are unquestionably a better team and organisation as a result of his
contributions."

That Philadelphia posted the one-game improvement from Kapler's first year at
the helm was a significant disappointment after bringing in Bryce Harper, J.T.
Realmuto, Andrew McCutchen, Jean Segura and David Robertson.

Those additions bumped the opening day payroll up $45million from 2018, but
the Phillies missed the playoffs for the eighth consecutive year.

That was enough for Middleton to make the move, and now he will look for a
manager who can vault the Phillies back into regular postseason contention.

Story continues

"We came into 2019 with very high hopes. We fell short of those, and that
responsibility lies with me," Kapler said in a release.

"The next Phillies manager will inherit a team of talented, dedicated and
committed players. There has been nothing more fulfilling in my professional
career than the opportunity to work with the players on this team. I will
forever value the relationships I developed with them.

"As I move on, I know that this organisation is in a great spot and will see a
lot of success going forward. My hope is that I helped contribute to a
developing culture in the organisation that flourishes in the years to come.

"I've come to care for this franchise and have the best wishes for this group
in the future. The passion and devotion of the Phillies fan base both inspired
and humbled me daily.

"It was an honour to grow, develop and learn with this team. I'm looking
forward to what the future brings, and I know I'm a better leader and person
for having had this opportunity."

#  Startup Canada Podcast: Aluvion Law founder Eric Apps on disrupting age-old
industries

![startup canada podcast](https://cdn.betakit.com/wp-
content/uploads/2017/04/BK_disrupting_age_old_industries_podcast_April_4.png)

What does it take to disrupt an industry? This is a common question asked by
entrepreneurs looking to power the next tsunami of change. Eric Apps is making
waves in the field of law by using his experiences as an entrepreneur to
innovate.

“As an entrepreneur, disrupting an industry doesn’t mean getting into a fight
or competing at a higher level, but it entails knowing who you want to
disrupt, how you are going to go about it, and how you are going to get money
out of it,” said Apps.

Apps is a Toronto-based serial entrepreneur on a mission. He is the co-founder
of Aluvion Law, Organimi, and founding partner of Wildeboer Dellelce LLP. Apps
was President of an AI and machine learning software company called Angoss for
over a decade, long before it was fashionable.

In this week’s #StartupPodcast, host Rivers Corbett talks to Apps about how he
combines tech, business, and law to disrupt an age-old industry.

_[The Startup Canada Podcast Show](http://www.startupcan.ca/podcasts/) is a
production of Startup Canada, a grassroots, entrepreneur-led movement to bring
together, celebrate, and give a voice to Canada’s entrepreneurship community.
On the podcast, award-winning entrepreneur host Rivers Corbett speaks with the
movers and shakers of Canada’s entrepreneurship community to give a glimpse
into the future of business, and share insights on everything from social
innovation to the future of work, investing, and why we need to think bigger
to take our businesses global. Join Rivers Corbett for new episodes every
Tuesday airing at 10 AM ET for lessons, trends, and opportunities in
entrepreneurship from Vancouver to Fredericton; and Israel to Peru.

You can find every episode of The Startup Canada Podcast Show at
[www.startupcan.ca/podcasts/](http://www.startupcan.ca/podcasts/)._

Kevin Costner in talks to join Jessica Chastain and Idris Elba in 'Molly's
Game'

More

Oscar-winning actor Kevin Costner looks set to join Jessica Chastain and Idris
Elba in Aaron Sorkin's "Molly's Game" reports
[Deadline](http://deadline.com/2016/10/kevin-costner-cast-mollys-game-aaron-
sorkin-jessica-chastain-1201837710/).

Chastain is already confirmed to be playing the movie's title character Molly
Bloom, with Costner currently in talks for the role of Bloom's father.

The film, which has been adapted from Bloom's memoir by Sorkin, will tell the
true story of the Olympic-class skier, who ran the world's most exclusive
high-stakes poker game for a decade before being arrested in the middle of the
night by the FBI.

Hollywood royalty, sports stars, and business moguls all played at Bloom's
poker games, but unbeknownst to her, also the Russian mob.

British actor Elba is set to play Bloom's lawyer and only ally, who learns
that there's much more to Bloom than what is reported in the tabloids.

Costner can next be seen in "Hidden Figures" alongside Octavia Spencer and
Kirsten Dunst, set to be released on Christmas Day.

'An American Werewolf In London' remake in the works

More

Horror movie "An American Werewolf in London" is getting a remake reports
[Deadline](http://deadline.com/2016/11/an-american-werewolf-in-london-remake-
on-way-max-landis-universal-1201850435/).

The 1981 John Landis classic is set to be rewritten and directed by the
filmmaker's son Max, with "The Walking Dead" producers David Alpert and Robert
Kirkman producing through their Skybound Entertainment for Universal Pictures.

The original movie, which marks its 35th anniversary this year, starred David
Naughton, known at the time for his Dr. Pepper commercials, Jenny Agutter and
Griffin Dunne.

The film told the story of two kids on a hiking holiday in England who are
attacked by a werewolf. Dunne's character is killed but Naughton's survives,
albeit as a werewolf.

Although it initially opened to mixed reviews, the film soon became a cult
classic.

# Barcelona’s new retina-burning away kit

Brooks Peck

Dirty TackleMay 22, 2012, 6:38 PM UTC

[![](https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/mG6LBc_jEFj_QriZCdow8Q--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTY0MDtoPTM1OS42MTkwNDc2MTkwNDc2/https://media.zenfs.com/en/blogs/sptussowexperts/photo_m2a_equip.jpeg)](http://media.zenfs.com/en/blogs/sptussowexperts/photo_m2a_equip.jpeg)

We saw [Barcelona's 2012/13 fuzzy striped home
kit](http://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/soccer-dirty-tackle/now-buy-barcelona-ugly-
shirt-ebay-162519375.html) before it was officially released, so the real
shocker of Tuesday's unveiling was the orange and yellow away kit. Sort of
like staring at the sun after squirting alcohol into your eyes, [the club's
official website](http://www.fcbarcelona.com/club/detail/article/orange-and-
yellow-change-strip) describes it as "a veritable array of vibrant colors to
celebrate the team's dazzling football."

It continues:

 __

> The FC Barcelona change strip for the 2012/13 season merges orange and
> yellow in honour of the city's culture, art, style and architecture. It has
> a classic orange collar with the famous Barça colours on the nape and
> sleeves. The back of the shirt also features the Catalan flag, and the 'More
> Than a Club' slogan on the inside of the collar, written in a typeface was
> specially chosen to reflect Catalan architecture.

I'm not sure I've ever heard a bright orange collar described as "classic"
before, but if orange and yellow are accurate reflections on the city's
culture, art, style and architecture then, clearly, the entire city is on
fire. Hopefully Leo Messi keeps his Lego collection in a flame-retardant room.

Here's the comparatively subtle home shirt...

[![]()![](https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/D5CLjXnxPUKsnYvzJR6OGQ--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTY0MDtoPTM1OS42MTkwNDc2MTkwNDc2/https://media.zenfs.com/en/blogs/sptussowexperts/Nike_Better_World.jpeg)](http://media.zenfs.com/en/blogs/sptussowexperts/Nike_Better_World.jpeg)
